{{more footnotes|date=June 2010}} {{use American English|date=May 2016}} {{use mdy dates|date=May 2016}} The '''Dogs of the Dow''' is an [[investment strategy]] popularized by Michael B. O'Higgins in 1991, which proposes that an investor annually select for investment the ten [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] (DJIA) stocks whose [[dividend]] is the highest fraction of their price.
==History== Selecting some components of the DJIA is not a new idea. An article by H. G. Schneider was published in ''[[The Journal of Finance]]'' in 1951, based on selecting stocks by their [[price–earnings ratio]].<ref>Staff (undated). [http://www.investorhome.com/dogs.htm "'Dogs of the Dow' and the 'Foolish Four'"]. investorhome.com. Retrieved May 11, 2016.</ref>
==Concept== Proponents of the Dogs of the Dow strategy argue that [[Blue chip (stock market)|blue-chip]] companies do not alter their dividend to reflect trading conditions and, therefore, the dividend is a measure of the average worth of the company; the stock price, in contrast, fluctuates through the [[business cycle]]. This should mean that companies with a [[High-yield stocks|high yield]], with a high dividend relative to stock price, are near the bottom of their business cycle and are likely to see their stock price increase faster than low-yield companies.
Under this model, an investor annually reinvesting in high-yield companies should out-perform the overall market. The logic behind this is that a high-dividend yield suggests both that the stock is oversold and that management believes in its company's prospects and is willing to back that up by paying out a relatively high dividend. Investors are thereby hoping to benefit from both above-average stock-price gains as well as a relatively high quarterly dividend. Of course, several assumptions are made in this argument.
The first assumption is that the dividend price reflects the company size rather than the company business model. The second is that companies have a natural, repeating cycle in which good performances are predicted by bad ones. Due to the nature of the concept, the Dogs may come from a small number of sectors. For example, the ten stocks that belonged to the 2015 Dogs of the Dow list came from only six sectors, including industrials, energy, and healthcare,<ref>{{Cite web| author = Chart (undated) | url = http://hellomoney.co/portfolio/3701a6-dogs-of-the-dow-2015|title = Dogs of the Dow 1015 – Comparing Performance Between S&P 500 and Dogs of the Dow – Stock List Is Based on DogsOfTheDow.com. | access-date = May 11, 2016 | publisher = Hello Money (hellomoney.co)}}</ref> in contrast to the [[S&P 500 Index]] which covers eleven sectors.
==Results== O'Higgins and others back-tested the strategy as far back as the 1920s and found that investing in the Dogs consistently outperformed the market as a whole. Since that time, the data shows that the Dogs of the Dow as well as the popular variant, the Small Dogs of the Dow, have performed well.
For example, for the twenty years from 1992 to 2011, the Dogs of the Dow matched the average annual total return of the DJIA (10.8 percent) and outperformed the S&P 500 (9.6 percent), as reported by the [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/ Dogs of the Dow] website located at dogsofthedow.com.
The Small Dogs of the Dow, which are the five lowest-priced Dogs of the Dow, outperformed both the Dow and S&P 500 with an average annual total return of 12.6 percent.<ref>{{cite web| author = Staff (undated) | title= Dogs of the Dow Total Return: Dog Years|url=http://www.dogsofthedow.com/dogyrs.htm|publisher= Dogs of the Dow | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref>
When each individual year is reviewed, it is clear that both the Dogs of the Dow and Small Dogs of the Dow did not outperform each and every year. In fact, the Dogs of the Dow and Small Dogs of the Dow struggled to keep up with the Dow during latter stages of the [[dot-com boom|dot-com boom (1998 and 1999)]] as well as during the [[Financial crisis of 2007–08|financial crisis (2007–2009)]].<ref>{{cite web| author = Staff (undated) | title=Dogs of the Dow|url=http://www.dogsofthedow.com |publisher=Dogs of the Dow | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref> This suggests that an investor would be best served by viewing this as a longer-term strategy by giving this portfolio of stocks time to recover in case of a rare-but-extreme economic event (e.g., dot-com boom, financial crisis).
==Criticism== On January 8, 2014, John S. Tobey wrote an article in ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine where he criticized the Dogs. He said that it should use [[price weighting]], instead of [[equal weighting]], because that is what the DJIA uses. He said that, for the year 2013, using the price weighting the Dogs would have returned less, rather than more, than the DJIA. He suggested that it is too simple and it should use more factors such as [[dividend payout ratio|dividend–payout ratio]], growth of cash and earnings, price performance, and many other things. However, he did not say how to combine these into a strategy. He also criticized it for back-testing (although the method was published in 1991). He also said that the strategy would not work well for 2014.<ref>{{cite web|date = January 8, 2014 | author = Tobey John S. | title=Ditch 'Dogs of the Dow' – The Mutts Have Bad Genes, Improper Breeding and False Papers | work = [[Forbes]] | url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/johntobey/2014/01/08/ditch-dogs-of-the-dow-the-mutts-have-bad-genes-improper-breeding-and-false-papers | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Business and economics}} * [[S&P Dow Jones Indexes]] * [[Foolish Four]] {{clear}}
==References== {{reflist}}
==Bibliography== * O'Higgins, Michael; Downes, John (2000, revised and updated). ''Beating the Dow – A High-Return, Low-Risk Method for Investing in the Dow Jones Industrial Stocks with as Little as $5,000''. [[HarperBusiness]]. {{ISBN|978-0066620473}}.
==External links== * [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/ Dogs of the Dow] has been tracking this investment strategy since 1995 * [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/dogday.htm Latest performance of the Dogs of the Dow] * [http://www.investorhome.com/dogs.htm Dogs of the Dow and the 'Foolish Four']
{{stock market}}

{{Refimprove|date=October 2017}} {{Contract law}} '''Expectation damages''' are [[damages]] recoverable from a [[breach of contract|breach]] of [[contract]] by the non-breaching party. An award of expectation damages protects the injured party's interest in realizing the value of the expectancy that was created by the promise of the other party.
The purpose of expectation damages is to put the non-breaching [[plaintiff|party]] in the position it would have occupied had the contract been fulfilled. Expectation damages can be contrasted to [[reliance damages]] and [[restitution|restitution damages]], which are remedies that address other types of interests of parties involved in [[contract|enforceable promises]].
The default for expectation damages are monetary damages which are subject to limitations or exceptions (see below)
Expectation damages are measured by the diminution in value, coupled with [[consequential damages|consequential]] and [[incidental damages|incidental]] damages.
== Measuring Expectation Damages == In expectation damages, the measure of damages is the difference between what was given and what was promised, along with consequential and incidental expenses minus any payments received from the breaching party and any costs saved as a result of the breach.<ref>{{cite AustLII|HCA|36|1954|litigants=Bellgrove v Eldridge |parallelcite=(1954) 90 [[Commonwealth Law Reports|CLR]] 613 |courtname=auto}}.</ref> The proper amount is that which gives the non-breaching party the "benefit of the bargain." However, it is important to note that expectation damages are not punitive; its theoretical purpose is to place the injured, non-breaching party in the same position that they would have occupied had there been full performance of the contract.<ref>{{cite AustLII|HCA|56|2013|litigants=Clark v Macourt |parallelcite=(2013) 253 [[Commonwealth Law Reports|CLR]] 1 |courtname=auto}}.</ref> In other words, it is the amount that makes the injured party indifferent to the breach.
Examples: *General contractor accepts an offer from a subcontractor and enters into a contract. The general contractor breaches / repudiates their contract part way through the subcontractor's performance. Generally, the subcontractor is entitled to seek an amount equal to the contract price or unrealized value of the promised performance plus costs incurred in preparing or performing under the contract (and costs incidental to the breach e.g., storage costs, restocking fees for returns; penalties or costs for canceling contracts, supply orders etc.) minus any progress payments made by the general contractor and minus costs saved by the breach; can include anticipated profit. *Neal signs a contract agreeing to buy 10 hours of landscaping services from John's Landscaping for $50 an hour. If Neal breaks the contract and doesn't use any of John's Landscaping's services, expectation damages paid to John's Landscaping would be $500 minus any costs John's Landscaping may have saved, which is the economic loss they suffered. If John's Landscaping breaks the contract, and Neal is forced to hire another service for $60 an hour, expectation (direct) damages paid to Neal would equal $100 ($10 an hour, the difference in price between the original contract and the new contract).
==Potential Exceptions or Limitations ==
* Duty to mitigate - the aggrieved party has a duty to take reasonable steps to mitigate damages. Failure to take such steps can cut off damages which arose from such a failure to take reasonable steps to mitigate. This is a duty of reasonable care thus no duty to take steps which are unreasonably burdensome. Example - buyer breaches contract to purchase produce; seller is expected to mitigate e.g., "cover" under the U.S. Uniform Commercial Code or resale; failure to make reasonable attempts to resell can be a ground to deny damages arising from breach e.g., spoilage. Breaching party is liable for costs which arise from an effort to take reasonable steps to mitigate. E.g., party continues to work after being notified of a breach and running up the bill. (however, this might be reasonable if the aggrieved party reasonably believed they had a better chance of selling a completed product to an alternative buyer). * Reasonable certainty - must be able to calculate the damages based on reasonably certain facts or comparable situations. Cannot have a calculation based wholly on guesses. In cases of doubt, many jurisdictions have adopted a view that the breaching party should bear the risk of doubt rather than the aggrieved party. * Foreseeability - Generally, no consequential damages unless they are known or foreseeable. e.g., No lost profits for third party transactions (e.g., Hadley v. Baxendale case below), holding that Baxendale could only be held liable for losses that were generally foreseeable, or if Hadley had mentioned his special circumstances in advance. The mere fact that a party is sending something to be repaired does not indicate that they would lose profits if it were not delivered on time. The court suggested various other circumstances under which Hadley could have entered into this contract that would not have presented such dire circumstances, and noted that where special circumstances exist, provisions can be made in the contract voluntarily entered into by the parties to impose extra damages for a breach. e.g. [[Hadley v Baxendale]].<ref>{{cite BAILII |litigants=[[Hadley v Baxendale]] |court=EWHC |division =Exch |year=1854 |num=J70 |paralleicte=[1854] 156 [[English Reports|ER]] 145 |copurtname=auto}}.</ref> * Cost of performance or a proposed measure of damage greatly exceeds market value of full performance ([[Peevyhouse v. Garland Coal & Mining Co.|Peevyhouse v Garland Coal & Mining Co]]) E.g., land owner contract with coal company promised restoration of land after mining complete - coal company refused to comply; court found the cost of restoration (~$30k) grossly exceeded value of the property in unrestored condition ($300 price difference between condition before and after coal mining). However, this case has been widely criticized; 2nd Restatement of the Law criticized it; many courts will not follow this rule thus would decline to award damages based on market value based on view that damages should be awarded based on actual harm to injured party versus hypothetical market value - dependent on jurisdiction)
==See also== * ''[[Robinson v Harman]]'', (1848) 1 Ex Rep 850 is an English contract law case concluding that the claimant ought to be placed in the same situation, with respect to damages, as if the contract had been performed. * ''[[Smith v. Bolles]]'', 132 U.S. 125 (1889), limiting expectation damages from fraudulent conduct to those legitimately attributable to defendant's misrepresentation, and precluding awards based on unrealized speculation. * ''[[Hawkins v. McGee]]'', 84 N.H. 114, 146 A. 641 (N.H. 1929) the "Case of the Hairy Hand" in New Hampshire state case law. * [[Loss of chance in English law]] * [[Restatement (Second) of Contracts]] * [http://www.lexinter.net/LOTWVers4/remedies.htm#§344._PURPOSES_OF_REMEDIES Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 344(a)], Purpose of Remedies * [http://www.lexinter.net/LOTWVers4/measure_of_damages.htm Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 347], Measure of Damages in General * [[Uniform Commercial Code]] (UCC)
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Expectation Damages}} [[Category:Contract law]]

{{Infobox person |name=Federico Santa María |image=FedericoSantaMaria.jpg |caption= |birth_date={{birth date|1845|08|15|mf=y}} |birth_place=[[Valparaíso, Chile|Valparaíso]], [[Chile]] |death_date={{death date and age|1925|12|20|1845|10|13|mf=y}} |death_place=[[Paris, France|Paris]], [[France]] }} '''Federico Santa María Carrera''' (c. August 15, 1845 - December 20, 1925) was a [[Chile]]an businessman and [[philanthropist]]. He was of [[Basque people|Basque]] descent and member of the notable [[Carrera family]].<ref>http://diario.elmercurio.cl/detalle/index.asp?id={09b31ebd-bb5c-419c-87c7-3069540a13e3}</ref>
Federico Santa María was born in [[Valparaíso, Chile|Valparaíso]], the son of Juan Antonio Santa María Artigas and of Magdalena Carrera Aguirre. Although he was a member of two of the most respected and influential Chilean families of the 19th century, the [[Domingo Santa María|Santa María]] and the [[Carrera family|Carrera]] families, he made his huge fortune in the sugar markets of [[Paris]], in which he arrived when he was very young.
His importance in the sugar market was considerable: he became a major power in the French economy. During [[World War I]] he closed down all his businesses, declaring that he did not want to profit from war. He also supported the French Army, donating clothes and weapons for an entire regiment.
However, once the war ended, in 1922 he started to purchase important quantities of sugar in the stock market. As analysts later declared that sugar production would be at a deficit that year, this led to enormous profits for Santa Maria. For this success he was investigated by the French national assembly, but it was determined that he had acted within legal bounds<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bibliotecas.usm.cl/web/wp-content/uploads/historicos/087_80%20a%C3%B1os%20de%20universidad.pdf|title=Especial 80 años Universidad Santa Maria|last=|first=|date=|website=Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
Federico Santa Maria was a very atypical millionaire for his time. Profoundly anti-clerical, he never got married yet lived together for decades with the French woman Anna Guillaud<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ciperchile.cl/2014/11/03/agustin-edwards-una-biografia-desclasificada-del-dueno-de-el-mercurio/|title=Agustín Edwards Eastman: Una biografía desclasificada del dueño de El Mercurio {{!}} CIPER Chile CIPER Chile » Centro de Investigación e Información Periodística|website=ciperchile.cl|language=es-ES|access-date=2017-11-29}}</ref>.
Because he had no descendants, he gave his entire fortune to his hometown [[Valparaíso]] for the founding of a technical and engineering school. The result of his legacy was the [[UTFSM|Federico Santa María Technical University]].
He was a distant relative of famous Chilean pianist [[Claudio Arrau]].
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.utfsm.cl UTFSM home page] *[http://www.utfsm.cl/universidad/testamento.htm Santa María's Testament] *[http://www.genealog.cl/Chile/S/SantaMaria/#SantaMariaCarrera,Federico Genealogical chart of Santa María family] {{es icon}} *[https://www.timetoast.com/timelines/federico-santa-maria-carrera Federico Santa Maria timeline]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Santa Maria, Federico}} [[Category:1845 births]] [[Category:1925 deaths]] [[Category:Chilean businesspeople]] [[Category:Chilean philanthropists]] [[Category:Chilean people of Basque descent]] [[Category:People from Valparaíso]]

{{For|other uses of the name AutoAlliance|AutoAlliance (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox building | name = Flat Rock Assembly Plant | native_name = | native_name_lang = | logo = | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | image = Auto Alliance International plant Flat Rock Michigan.JPG | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = AutoAlliance International plant, 2010. | map_type = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map_size = | map_dot_label = | relief = | former_names = Michigan Casting Center (1972–1981)
Mazda Motor Manufacturing USA (1987–1992)
AutoAlliance International (1992–2012) | alternate_names = | etymology = | status = | cancelled = | topped_out = | building_type = | architectural_style = | classification = Factory | location = | address = 1 International Drive | location_city = [[Flat Rock, Michigan|Flat Rock]], [[Michigan]] | location_country = [[United States|United States of America]] | coordinates = {{Coord|42|6|24.6054|N|83|14|52.3752|W|region:US_type:landmark|display=title}} | altitude = | current_tenants = | namesake = | groundbreaking_date = | start_date = | topped_out_date = | completion_date = | opened_date = January 1972 | inauguration_date = | relocated_date = | renovation_date = | closing_date = | demolition_date = | cost = | ren_cost = | client = | owner = [[Ford Motor Company]] | landlord = | affiliation = | height = | architectural = | tip = | antenna_spire = | roof = | top_floor = | observatory = | diameter = | circumference = | weight = | other_dimensions = | structural_system = | material = | size = | floor_count = | floor_area = | elevator_count = | grounds_area = | architect = | architecture_firm = | developer = | engineer = | structural_engineer = | services_engineer = | civil_engineer = | other_designers = | quantity_surveyor = | main_contractor = | awards = | designations = | known_for = | ren_architect = | ren_firm = | ren_engineer = | ren_str_engineer = | ren_serv_engineer = | ren_civ_engineer = | ren_oth_designers = | ren_qty_surveyor = | ren_contractor = | ren_awards = | seating_type = | seating_capacity = | rooms = | parking = | url = | embed = | embedded = | references = | footnotes = }} '''Flat Rock Assembly Plant''', formerly known as Ford's Michigan Casting Center (MCC) (1972–81), Mazda Motor Manufacturing USA (1987–92) and '''AutoAlliance International''' (1992–2012), is a [[Ford Motor Company]] assembly plant located at {{nowrap|1 International}} Drive in [[Flat Rock, Michigan]] in [[Metro Detroit]]. The plant currently comprises {{convert|2900000|sqft|m2}} of production space and employs 3,510 hourly workers and 140 salaried workers — and currently manufactures the [[Ford Mustang]] coupe and the tenth generation [[Lincoln Continental#Tenth generation (2017–present)|Lincoln Continental]]. ==History== [[File:FORD MOTOR COMPANY'S NEW CASTING PLANT AT FLAT ROCK - NARA - 549726.jpg|thumb|right|Casting plant, 1973.]] Following three years of work and the largest single investment by Ford, the Michigan Casting Center (MCC) opened in January 1972, at the time one of the most technologically advanced casting facilities in the world.{{cite web|title=Ford Opens a Giant Casting Centre|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=6GwtAAAAIBAJ&sjid=4YkFAAAAIBAJ&dq=michigan%20casting%20center%20opened&pg=2695%2C4464032|work=Schenectady Gazette|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=20 January 1972}} Despite the sizable capital investment, frequent union labor problems and work injuries{{cite web|title=Detroit plant|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=jTQ_AAAAIBAJ&sjid=d1EMAAAAIBAJ&dq=michigan%20casting%20center%20opened&pg=1110%2C375353|work=Windsor Star|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=1 November 1973}} and declining demand for the V8 engine blocks produced there led to the facility's closure in 1981.{{cite web|title=Ford Will Close Unit in Flat Rock|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1981/09/15/business/ford-will-close-unit-in-flat-rock.html|work=New York Times|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=15 September 1981}}{{cite web|title=Flat Rock Mayor Hopeful|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=IFwiAAAAIBAJ&sjid=AasFAAAAIBAJ&dq=michigan%20casting%20center%20closed&pg=1337%2C2901659|work=The Argus-Press|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=3 December 1984}} A worker, [[Robert Williams (robot fatality)|Robert Williams]], was killed by an [[industrial robot]] arm on January 25, 1979. He is the first known human to be killed by a robot. [[Mazda|Mazda Motor Corporation]] started construction of a new building on the site of the Michigan Casting Center in 1985 and cars started production at Mazda Motor Manufacturing USA in September 1987 with the [[Mazda MX-6]] and [[Ford Probe]] coupes.{{cite web|last=Manji|first=James F.|title=Building cars with Mazda quality. (Mazda Motor Manufacturing USA Corp.)|url=http://business.highbeam.com/438319/article-1G1-6458174/building-cars-mazda-quality|work=Automation|publisher=Penton Business Media, Inc.|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=1 June 1988}} In 1991 the plant had 3,600 employees, including 250 Japanese employees.Cohen, Sharon. "[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1346&dat=19911225&id=g7ROAAAAIBAJ&sjid=J_wDAAAAIBAJ&pg=1797,3219645 Metamorphosis in Motown]." ''[[Associated Press]]'' at ''[[The Ledger]]''. Thursday December 26, 1991. p. 7C. Retrieved from [[Google News]] (95 of 121) on November 19, 2013. Ford repurchased a 50% share in the plant on April 15, 1992, and it officially became a joint-venture and was renamed AutoAlliance International on July 1, 1992.{{cite web|title=North American All-New Mazda6 Production Begins at AutoAlliance International|url=http://www.mazda.com/publicity/release/2008/200807/080723.html|work=Mazda|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=23 July 2008}} The plant began production of all models of the [[Mazda 626]] sold in America starting in 1993. During this era, [[Deepak Ahuja]] was Chief Financial Officer of the joint venture.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/magazine/fall-2011/PDF/alumni-profile-deepak-ahuja.pdf|title=Alumni profile: Deepak Ahuja|work=McCormick Magazine|issue=Fall 2011|page=42|date=11 November 2011|accessdate=18 September 2018|first=Leanne|last=Star}} The [[Ford Contour]]-derived [[Mercury Cougar]] was produced at the plant from 1998 to 2002. Production of North American [[Mazda 6]] began in the 2003 model year, followed by the [[Ford Mustang]] starting in 2005. The last Mazda 6 rolled off the line on Friday, August 24, 2012, with Mazda discontinuing production on American soil, effectively ending the 20 year joint-venture between Mazda and Ford. Mazda moved production of the Mazda 6 back to the [[Hofu (Mazda factory)|Hofu factory]] in Japan and opened a new factory in Salamanca, Mexico to build the [[Mazda 2]] and [[Mazda 3]] subcompact and compact cars. On September 10, 2012, Ford Motor Company re-took full management control of the plant, renaming it the Ford Flat Rock Assembly Plant, and confirming $555 million in investments designed to retool the plant for the production of the 2013 [[Ford Fusion (Americas)|Ford Fusion]] midsize sedan.{{cite web |url=http://media.ford.com/article_display.cfm?article_id=37067 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-11-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121112164832/http://media.ford.com/article_display.cfm?article_id=37067 |archivedate=2012-11-12 |df= }} On July 15, 2015, Ford confirmed that the new 2017 [[Lincoln Continental]] sedan would be produced at the Flat Rock plant starting in 2016.{{cite web|title=Lincoln Continental to be made at Ford Flat Rock plant|url=http://www.freep.com/story/money/cars/ford/2015/07/15/ford-confirms-lincoln-continental-production-flat-rock-michigan-plant/30197835|date=15 July 2015}} On January 3, 2017, Ford announced that it will begin manufacturing an electric small SUV by 2020, and a high passenger volume autonomous vehicle designed for commercial ride hailing or ride sharing by 2021, both to be built at Flat Rock.https://media.ford.com/content/fordmedia/fna/us/en/news/2017/01/03/ford-adding-electrified-f-150-mustang-transit-by-2020.html ==Products made== *[[Ford Mustang]] (2005–present){{cite web|last=Henkel|first=Karl|title=Ford begins hiring 1,400 for Flat Rock plant|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/article/20130409/AUTO0102/304090436/1121/auto01/Ford-begins-hiring-1-400-for-Flat-Rock-plant|work=Detroit News|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=9 April 2013|dead-url=yes}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} *[[Lincoln Continental]] (2017–present) {{cite web|title=New Lincoln Continental will be Michigan made|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/cars/2015/07/15/ford-lincoln-contenental/30208199/|publisher=USA Today|date=15 July 2015|accessdate=16 July 2015}} ==Past== [[File:Ford Probe V6 24V gt.jpg|thumb|Ford Probe V6 24V GT built at Flat Rock in 1995, customized in France in 2016.]] *[[Mazda MX-6]] (1988–1997) *[[Ford Probe]] (1989–1997) *[[Mazda 626]] (1990–2002) *[[Mercury Cougar]] (1999–2002) *[[Mazda 6]] (2003–2012){{cite web|last=Pope|first=Byron|title=Ford Expects Fusion Output to Exceed Mazda6 at Flat Rock|url=http://wardsauto.com/auto-makers/ford-expects-fusion-output-exceed-mazda6-flat-rock|work=Wards Auto|accessdate=11 April 2013|date=10 September 2012}} *[[Ford Fusion (Americas)|Ford Fusion]] ''Working for the Japanese''. [[Simon & Schuster]], June 30, 2008. {{ISBN|1439106487}}, 9781439106488. **The section starting at p. 101 discusses [[History of the Japanese in Metro Detroit|Japanese employees]] from [[Mazda]] working in the Flat Rock Assembly Plant along with Americans in the 1980s. {{Ford factories}} {{Ford Motor Company}} [[Category:Ford factories]] [[Category:Mazda factories]] [[Category:Joint ventures]] [[Category:Motor vehicle assembly plants in Michigan]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Wayne County, Michigan]] [[Category:1972 establishments in Michigan]]

{{Infobox person | name = Francesco Illy | image = Illy Ferenc.jpg | caption = Francesco Illy | birth_name = Ferenc Illy | birth_date = {{birth date|1892|10|07|}} | birth_place = [[Temesvár]], [[Austria-Hungary]]
(now [[Timișoara]], [[Romania]]) | death_date = 1956 | death_place = [[Trieste]], [[Italy]] | residence = [[Triest]], [[Austria-Hungary]] | citizenship = [[Hungary|Hungarian]] | alma_mater = Temesvári Piarista Gimnázium | occupation = | known_for = founder of [[illy]]
inventor of the Illetta (coffemachine) | networth = | boards = [[CEO]] [[Illy]]caffé | spouse = Vittoria | children = [[Ernesto Illy|Ernesto]]
Hedda | mother = Aloisia Rössler | father = János Illy | relatives = [[Riccardo Illy]] (grandson)
[[Andrea Illy]] (grandson) | religion = }} '''Francesco Illy''' ({{lang-hu|Illy Ferenc}}; 1892, [[Temesvár]], [[Kingdom of Hungary|Hungary]] (now [[Timișoara]], [[Romania]]) – 1956, [[Trieste]], [[Italy]]) was a [[Hungarian people|Hungarian]] financial accountant, bookkeeper, business magnate, philanthropist, the founder of [[illy]] and [[inventor]] of coffee machinery. ==Biography== Illy was born to a middle-class family in Temesvár (now [[Timisoara]], [[Romania]]). His father, János Illy was a carpenter. His mother, Aloisia Rössler was [[Danube Swabians|Danube Swabian]]. He studied economics in Temesvár. After secondary school he moved to [[Vienna]], where he worked for two big Transylvanian companies. At the age of 22 he was [[Conscription|conscripted]] into the [[Austro-Hungarian Army]], and served from 1914 at almost every front of the First World War, including at the [[Battle of Kraśnik]] and the [[Battles of the Isonzo]]. After the war he stayed with his sister in [[Trieste]], where he soon married a Triestine woman. He found work with companies dealing with [[Cocoa bean|cocoa]] and [[coffee roasting]]. He later invented his own method for maintaining the quality of freshly roasted coffee so it could be delivered to other locations rather than roasting it on site. He formed a partnership with the local coffee manufacturers Hausbrandt. In 1933 Illy founded [[illycaffè]],{{Cite news |publisher=Fortune magazine |title=Crisis in a Coffee Cup |first=Nicholas |last=Stein |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2002/12/09/333463/index.htm |date=9 December 2009 |accessdate=25 April 2009}} which invented the first automatic coffee machine which substituted pressurized water for steam. The ''Illetta'' became the predecessor of today's [[espresso machine]].{{Cite news |first=John |last=Tagliabue |title=Coffeehouses as Fashion Boutiques; Selling Cachet by the Cup |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/26/business/worldbusiness/26eurocoffee.html?pagewanted=1&n=Top/Reference/Times%20Topics/Subjects/C/Coffee |publisher=The New York Times |date=26 December 2006 |accessdate=25 April 2009 }} His son, the food chemist [[Ernesto Illy]] (1925–2008) took over the management of the coffee company, which is now in the hands of the third generation Illys. ==References== {{reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Illy, Francesco}} [[Category:Businesspeople in the drink industry]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Italian people of Hungarian descent]] [[Category:Danube-Swabian people]] [[Category:Hungarian inventors]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople in coffee]] [[Category:People from Trieste]] [[Category:People from Timișoara]] [[Category:1892 births]] [[Category:1956 deaths]] [[Category:Austro-Hungarian people]] [[Category:19th-century Hungarian people]] [[Category:Hungarian industrialists]] [[Category:Hungarian chief executives]] [[Category:19th-century businesspeople]] [[Category:Hungarian people stubs]] [[Category:Hungarian Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholics]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2016}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2013}} {{Philippine name|Diaz|Wilson|Burnand|ph=married}} {{Infobox model | image = Georgina_Wilson_endorsing_Garnier_at_Trinoma,_October_2012.jpg | caption = Wilson endorsing [[Garnier]] at the [[TriNoma]] mall in [[Quezon City]], October 2012 | name = Georgina Wilson | birthname = Georgina Ashley Diaz Wilson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|2|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Wichita, Kansas]], U.S. | nationality = [[Filipino British|Filipino-British]] | alma_mater = [[University of Sydney]] | height = {{height|m=1.78}} | occupation = Actress, host, model, endorser, VJ | years_active = 2003–present | hair_color = | measurements = | weight = | dress_size = | shoe_size = | agency = | spouse = {{marriage|Arthur Burnand|30 April 2016|}} | children = 1 | relatives = [[Gloria Diaz]] (aunt)
[[Isabelle Daza]] (cousin) | website = [http://ilovegeorgina.com Official website] }} '''Georgina Ashley Diaz Wilson-Burnand''' (born 12 February 1986) is a [[Filipino British|Filipino-British]] model, actress, host and VJ. In 2015, Wilson hosted the [[Asia's Next Top Model (cycle 3)|third cycle]] of the reality show, ''[[Asia's Next Top Model]]''. ==Early life== Georgina Ashley Diaz Wilson was born on 12 February 1986 in [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita]], [[Kansas]], United States.{{cite web |url= http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/35875/gorgeous-george-gutsy-glib-and-glamorous-model-and-host-georgina-wilson-is-a-force-to-reckon-with |title=Gorgeous George: Gutsy, glib, and glamorous, model and host Georgina Wilson is a force to reckon with | |first= Adrienne |last= Dy |work=Look Magazine|date= 22 February 2012 |accessdate=6 July 2013}} Her mother is Aurora Diaz, a Filipina, while her father is Robert Wilson, who is of British descent. Through her mother, she is the niece of former Miss Universe [[Gloria Diaz]], and the cousin of her daughter, actress, model and host [[Isabelle Daza]]. The eldest among three siblings, Wilson has a younger sister named Jessica, who is also a model, and a younger brother named Samuel.{{cite web|last1=Cruz|first1=Kitchie|title=In their First Ever Pictorial Together, the Diaz Girls, Georgina and Jessica Wilson, Isabelle and Ava Daza, and Martine Cajucom, Get Cozy and Talk About Family and Style|url=http://ph.hola.com/celebrity-news/diaz-girls.html|publisher=''[[¡Hola!|¡Hola! Philippines]]''|accessdate=1 May 2016|date=7 March 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Fernandez|first1=Merla|title=20 non-showbiz but good-looking brothers of stars|url=http://www.pep.ph/celeb/photos/9464/20-non-showbiz-but-good-looking-brothers-of-stars|accessdate=1 May 2016|work=[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]]|publisher=[[Summit Media]]|date=20 April 2016}} She moved to Bishop Thornton, [[Yorkshire, England]] when she was six months old and moved back to the Philippines with her family at age 10. Wilson attended high school at the [[Assumption College]] in [[Makati]] and attended college at the [[Ateneo de Manila University]], where she studied for a [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[economics]]. She later transferred to the [[University of Sydney]] in Australia, where she graduated with a [[Bachelor of Commerce]] in [[accounting]] and became a double major in finance.{{cite news|last1=Ang|first1=Raymond|title=Georgina Wilson & the sigh of the times|url=http://www.philstar.com/sunday-life/709102/georgina-wilson-sigh-times|accessdate=1 May 2016|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=24 July 2011}}{{cite news|last1=Villano|first1=Alexa|title=Georgina Wilson to fresh grads: Set yourselves apart, give it your all|url=http://www.rappler.com/life-and-style/career/88297-georgina-wilson-advice-fresh-graduates-asias-next-top-model|accessdate=1 May 2016|work=[[Rappler]]|date=29 March 2015}} ==Career== Wilson was offered numerous modeling projects since high school. She declined those offers due to the rules of her Catholic high school (Assumption) banning their students from working in modeling, TV and movies. When she graduated, she was cast in a [[Pond's]] commercial that aired in mid-2004. After which, she received more modeling and acting offers. Wilson is now the endorser of several products and brands in the Philippines, such as [[Bench (Philippine clothing brand)|Bench]], [[Garnier]], [[TechnoMarine]], [[Ginebra San Miguel]], [[Century Pacific Food|Argentina Corned Beef]], [[Fila (company)|Fila]], Belo Sexy Solutions, [[Unilever|Cream Silk]], [[American Apparel]], [[Cadbury]], [[Globe Telecom|Globe Tattoo]], [[BlackBerry]], [[Wade Ceramics|Wade]], [[The SM Store|SM Accessories]], Kashieca, and [[Jaguar XF|Jaguar]]. Wilson appears in Bench fashion shows every year and has been on several magazine covers. Wilson is also a VJ for [[Channel V]] and is the host of ''[[Asia's Next Top Model]]'' since its [[Asia's Next Top Model (cycle 3)|third cycle]] in 2015. Currently, she is also the marketing director of [[Sunnies Studios]], an eyewear brand she co-owns with Bea Soriano, Eric Dee Jr. and Martine Cajucom.{{cite web|title=Sunnies Studios|url=http://www.zalora.sg/magazine/#story/sunnies-studios_955827|website=Zalora|publisher=Zalora|accessdate=30 July 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Laurente|first1=Zoe|title=Sunnies Studios by the Numbers|url=http://www.stylebible.ph/fashion/style-report/sunnies-studios-by-the-numbers/|website=Style Bible PH|publisher=Summit Digital|accessdate=30 July 2015}} ==Personal life== By September 2015, Wilson began dating British businessman and hotelier Arthur Burnand.{{cite news|last1=Beltran|first1=Llhonette|title=22 celebrities who are in love with foreigners!|url=http://www.pep.ph/celeb/photos/9286/22-celebrities-who-are-in-love-with-foreigners|accessdate=1 May 2016|work=[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]]|publisher=[[Summit Media]]|date=22 February 2016}} According to Wilson, she and Burnand became engaged in October 2015. The couple married on 30 April 2016 in [[Winchester, England]].{{cite news|last1=Abando|first1=Paulyn|title=Georgina Wilson ties the knot in UK|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/georgina-wilson-ties-the-knot-in-uk/|accessdate=1 May 2016|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=1 May 2016}} In August 2016, Wilson confirmed that she and her husband were expecting their first child.{{cite news|title=Georgina Wilson confirms pregnancy|url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2016/08/30/1618804/georgina-wilson-confirms-pregnancy|accessdate=30 August 2016|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=30 August 2016}} Their son, Archie, was born on 14 December 2016.{{cite news|title=Georgina Wilson posts first photo of baby boy|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/life/12/26/16/georgina-wilson-posts-first-photo-of-baby-boy|accessdate=31 December 2016|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|date=26 December 2016}} ==Television credits== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Network |- | 2010–12 | ''[[Channel V Philippines]]'' | Host and VJ | [[Channel V Philippines]] |- | 2011 | ''[[Showtime (Philippines)|Showtime]]'' | Celebrity Judge | [[ABS-CBN]] |- | 2011–12 | ''The Source'' | Host | [[Star World Philippines]] |- | 2012 | ''[[Binibining Pilipinas 2012]]'' | Presenter | rowspan="2"|[[ABS-CBN]] |- | 2014 | ''[[It's Showtime (variety show)|It's Showtime]]'' | Celebrity Judge |- | 2015 | ''[[Asia's Next Top Model (cycle 3)]]'' | Host/Head Judge | [[Star World]] |- | rowspan="2"|2016 | ''[[Miss Indonesia 2016]]'' | Presenter | [[RCTI]] |- | ''[[Asia's Next Top Model (cycle 4)]]'' | Guest Judge | [[Star World]] |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://ilovegeorgina.com}} {{Asia's Next Top Model}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wilson, Georgina}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ateneo de Manila University alumni]] [[Category:British female models]] [[Category:Filipino female models]] [[Category:Filipino film actresses]] [[Category:Filipino Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Filipino television actresses]] [[Category:Filipino actresses]] [[Category:Filipino child actresses]] [[Category:Filipino people of British descent]] [[Category:People from Manila]] [[Category:Diaz family]] [[Category:People from Wichita, Kansas]] [[Category:People from Yorkshire]] [[Category:VJs (media personalities)]] [[Category:University of Sydney alumni]] [[Category:Filipino businesspeople]]

{{Infobox person | name = Gert Verhulst | image = GertVerhulst Pappielooptochnietzosnel 2017.jpg | image_size = | caption = Gert Verhulst in 2017 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1968|1|24}} | birth_name = Gert Tony Hubert Verhulst | birth_place = [[Berchem (Antwerp)|Berchem]], [[Belgium]] | nationality = [[Belgian]] | education = [[autodidact]], Refused at the Antwerp Academy of fine Arts.{{cite web|url=http://www.guido.be/JobsStages/ArticleDetail/tabid/175/ArticleId/9073/Default.aspx |title=Het jobparcours van Gert Verhulst |publisher=Guido.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} | occupation = managing director of [[Studio 100]] (1996–Present)
[[Television presenter|presenter]], [[entrepreneur]], [[singer]], [[film director|director]], [[actor]], [[Millionaire]] & [[business magnate]] | years_active = 1987, present | networth = {{increase}} [[euro|€]]241 [[Million]] (March 2017){{cite web|url=http://derijkstebelgen.be/vermogende/hans-bourlon-en-gert-verhulst/ |title=Hans Bourlon en Gert Verhulst - De Rijkste Belgen |publisher=Derijkstebelgen.be |date= |accessdate=2017-08-31}} | children = Victor (b. 1996) Marie (b. 1998) | awards = Gouden Pier Kloeffe,{{cite web|url=http://www.pretparken.be/article/26/Gert%20Verhulst%20wint%20%20'Gouden%20Pier%20Kloeffe' |title=Gert Verhulst wint 'Gouden Pier Kloeffe' |publisher=Pretparken.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} Manager of the year by [[Trends (Belgian magazine)|Trends]] {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/942/Economie/article/detail/598465/2009/01/07/Hans-Bourlon-en-Gert-Verhulst-managers-van-het-jaar.dhtml |title=Hans Bourlon en Gert Verhulst managers van het jaar |language=nl|publisher=HLN.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} | website = {{URL|studio100.tv}} | footnotes = {{Notelist|close}} }} '''Gert Tony Hubert Verhulst''' (born 24 January 1968 in [[Berchem (Antwerp)|Berchem]]) is a [[Belgian]] [[Television presenter|presenter]],{{cite web|author=Joris Truyts |url=http://deredactie.be/cm/vrtnieuws/cultuur%2Ben%2Bmedia/media/1.2214788 |title=Gert Verhulst wordt opnieuw presentator bij Vier |publisher=Deredactie.be |date=2015-01-21 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} [[entrepreneur]],{{cite web|url=http://business.belgium.be/en/investing_in_belgium/about_belgium/famous_belgian_entrepreneurs/ |title=Famous Belgian entrepreneurs - Investing in Belgium |publisher=Business.belgium.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} [[singer]],{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/artist/525306-Gert-Verhulst?filter_anv=0&subtype=Vocals&type=Credits |title=Gert Verhulst Discography: Vocals - Credits |publisher=Discogs.com |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} {{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/artist/525306-Gert-Verhulst?filter_anv=0&subtype=Writing-Arrangement&type=Credits |title=Gert Verhulst Discography: Writing-Arrangement - Credits |publisher=Discogs.com |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} [[autodidact]],{{cite web|url=http://ekonomika.be/index.php/b2u/42-utile/career-development/lecture-debate/b2u/213-belgian-entrepreneurship-success-stories-revealed |title=Belgian Entrepreneurship, Success Stories Revealed |publisher=Ekonomika.be |date=2012-11-27 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} [[film director|director]],{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0894219/#director|title=Gert Verhulst|work=IMDb}} [[actor]],{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0894219/#actor|title=Gert Verhulst|work=IMDb}} [[screenwriter]],{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0894219/#writer|title=Gert Verhulst|work=IMDb}} [[composer]],{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0894219/#music_department|title=Gert Verhulst|work=IMDb}} [[film producer]],{{Cite web|title = Gert Verhulst|url = https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0894219/|website = IMDb|accessdate = 2015-09-01}} [[Millionaire]] & [[business magnate]]. As a prominent figure within the children's entertainment industry in the [[Benelux]], he is regarded as a Belgian cultural icon, known for his influence and contributions to children' s entertainment in the Benelux and founder of [[Studio 100]]. ==Life and career== [[File:Samson & Gert Kerstshow 2010.JPG|thumb|right|The Samson and Gert Christmas show 2009]] Verhulst already knew on a very early age that he wanted to become famous (own words). In 1987 he applied at the "Koninkijk Conservatorium Antwerpen" (translated: The Royal Academy of fine Arts Antwerp) where he was rejected, he would recall this as a gift from Heaven.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.studio100fan.eu/forum/viewtopic.php?t=2141 |title=Forum • Toon onderwerp - [Interview] De 7 hoofdzonden volgens Gert Verhulst |publisher=Studio100fan.eu |date=2005-12-18 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} Later that year he got his first job at the former BRTN (now [[Vlaamse Radio- en Televisieomroeporganisatie|VRT]]) as [[continuity announcer]]. === Samson en Gert === '''Samson & Gert''' is a [[Flanders|Flemish]] children's television series produced by Eline van Noppen, centered on the talking dog Samson and his owner Gert. In its entire run, the show was originally aired on [[Eén|TV1]] from Christmas Day 1989 until 1 December 1997, where it moved to [[Ketnet]] and continues airing all of its episodes to this day. As a [[continuity announcer]] Verhulst wanted to make the announcements before children's television programmes more appealing by having an animal puppet next to him.{{cite web|url=http://starnews.cinenews.be/nl/sterren/Gert-Verhulst/biografie/ |title=Biografie : Gert Verhulst |language=fr|publisher=Starnews.cinenews.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} He got in touch with [[puppeteer]] Danny Verbiest, who created the puppet dog Samson. Samson, an [[Old English Sheepdog]], made his screen debut on 2 September 1989.{{cite web|url=http://www.ketnet.be/agenda/eerste-aflevering-samson-en-gert |title=Eerste keer Samson en Gert | Ketnet |publisher=Ketnet.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} The pair's popularity grew very rapidly in [[Flanders]] and they were given their own television series in 1990. The show, named ''Samson'', premiered on 2 September 1990. During the show, Samson and Gert and their friends would encounter many funny and chaotic situations. The plot would be interrupted for contests, fan mail and a variety of cartoons, such as [[The Smurfs]], [[Ovide and the Gang]], and [[Mrs. Pepper Pot (anime)|Mrs. Pepper Pot]]. === Zeg eens Euh! === Verhulst presented the language game "Zeg eens Euh!" (translated: Say Uh!) It was a game that was broadcast on Friday between 1992 and 1997{{cite web|url=http://www.vrt.be/tijdslijn/zeg-eens-euh |title=Zeg eens euh | VRT |publisher=Vrt.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} and whose concept was clearly inspired by the British radio game, ''[[Just a Minute]]''. The panelists alternately were given a theme that they had to talk about for one minute. Together with the theme they got a banned word that they could not use. In the panel were four Flemish celebrities including: "Emiel Goelen",{{cite web|url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/3808/Showbizz/video/detail/2237029/Emiel-Goelen-overleden-een-fragment-uit-Zeg-Eens-Euh.dhtml |title=Emiel Goelen overleden: een fragment uit 'Zeg Eens Euh!' |language=nl|publisher=HLN.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} "[[Margriet Hermans]]", "[[Koen Crucke]]" & "Jaak Pijpen". Occasionally one of these panelists was replaced by "Mark Tijsmans", "Andrea Croonenberghs", "[[Walter Baele]]"{{cite web|url=http://www.een.be/programmas/de-generatieshow/90-rosa-boycot-zeg-eens-euh |title=Eén - De generatieshow - 90 | Rosa boycot Zeg eens euh | Eén |publisher=Een.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} & "Paul Ambach".{{cite web|url=http://www.een.be/programmas/de-generatieshow/90-zeg-eens-euh-met-rosa-en-boogie-boy |title=Eén - De generatieshow - 90 | Zeg eens euh met Rosa en Boogie boy | Eén |publisher=Een.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} During the summer months, the viewer share rose from 700,000 to 800,000 viewers. When Verhulst moved to [[Vtm|VTM]], "Donaat Deriemaecker" took over the game but after a scandal involving one of the panel members, Emiel Goelen, the show was dismissed.{{cite web|url=http://www.tv-visie.be/nieuws/belgie/tv-visie-summertube-3-zeg-eens-euh_23983/ |title=TV-Visie SummerTube (3): 'Zeg eens Euh' | TVvisie |publisher=Tv-visie.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} === Move to VTM === In 1997 Verhulst moved to [[Vtm|VTM]] where he presented "Wat zegt u?" (translated: What do you say ?).{{cite web|url=http://www.showbizzsite.be/bio/gert-verhulst |title=Gert Verhulst | Showbizzsite |language=nl|publisher=Showbizzsite.be |date=2009-09-28 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} This was followed by "Linx"{{cite web|url=http://www.zangtalent.be/nl/85/1254/Gert-Verhulst |title=ZangTalent - Gert Verhulst |publisher=Zangtalent.be |date=1968-01-24 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} and in the summer of 1998 Verhulst presented "Sterrenslag" (translated: Star battle){{cite web|author= |url=http://www.demorgen.be/plus/sterrenslag-met-gert-verhulst-a-1412191744303/ |title=Sterrenslag met Gert Verhulst | archief | De Morgen |language=nl|publisher=Demorgen.be |date=1998-06-09 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} for several weeks because presenter 'Herbert Bruynseels' had had to withdraw due to illness. In the summer of 1999, the dialect game "Watte ?" (translated What?) started with the panel members: "Walter De Donder", "[[Koen Crucke]]" and "Simonne Peeters". === Studio 100 === [[File:Samson.JPG |thumb|left|Samson]] [[File:Eugène Van Leemhuyzen.jpg|thumb|right|Gert Verhulst and Walter Baele at the Book Fair 2009 in Antwerp]] Verhulst founded "[[Studio 100]]" in 1996 together with "Danny Verbiest", and "Hans Bourlon". They came together in 1989, when the programme "[[Samson en Gert]]" (translated "Samson and Gert") was first produced.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/929/TV-Gids/article/detail/1152537/2010/09/02/Ketnet-en-Studio-100-vieren-20-jaar-Samson-en-Gert.dhtml |title=Ketnet en Studio 100 vieren 20 jaar 'Samson en Gert' |language=nl|publisher=HLN.be |date=2010-09-02 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} Studio 100 started in 1996 with one program [[Samson en Gert]]. They immediately decided to create a new program to be able to advertise themselves more. They chose [[Kabouter Plop]] (translated Gnome Plop). It has been broadcast on [[Vlaamse Televisie Maatschappij|VTM]] since 1997. In 1999, Studio 100 expanded significantly with four new projects, all launched in [[Flanders]]: a musical, a film, and two new television programmes. For both the musical and the film, [[Vtm]] was asked to provide financial support.{{cite web|url=http://www.rektoverso.be/artikel/samson-en-gert-20-jaar-samen-op-de-moto |title=Samson en Gert 20 jaar samen op de moto | rekto:verso |publisher=Rektoverso.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} In October of '99, Studio 100 and the [[Medialaan|VMMa]] (Vlaamse Media Maatschappij, founded in 1987 as Vlaamse Televisie Maatschappij by nine publishers each with an 11.1% share),{{cite web|url=http://fokuskmo.be/editorial/gert-verhulst-hans-bourlon-studio-100-is-vrij-typisch-vlaams/ |title=Gert Verhulst & Hans Bourlon: ‘Studio 100 is vrij typisch Vlaams’ - Fokus KMO |publisher=Fokuskmo.be |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} announced that they would incorporate [[Meli Park]]. Right now [[Studio 100]] features five [[Amusement park]]s in [[Belgium]]{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.studio100.tv/activities/theme-parks/ |title=Studio100 " Theme Parks |publisher=Studio100.tv |date=2013-09-15 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} ("[[Plopsaland De Panne]]",{{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/plopsaland-de-panne/en |title=Home | Plopsaland De Panne |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} Mayaland Indoor {{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/mayaland-indoor/en |title=Home | Mayaland indoor |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} "Plopsa Indoor"{{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/plopsa-indoor-hasselt/en |title=Home | Plopsa Indoor Hasselt |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} [[Hasselt]], "Plopsa Coo"{{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/plopsa-coo/en |title=Home | Plopsa Coo |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} and "Plopsaqua"{{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/plopsaqua/en |title=Home | Plopsaqua |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}}), one in the [[Netherlands]] ("Plopsa Indoor" [[Coevorden]]{{cite web|url=http://www.plopsa.be/plopsa-indoor-coevorden/en |title=Home | Plopsa Indoor Coevorden |publisher=Plopsa.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}}) & one in [[Germany]] ([[Holiday Park, Germany|Holiday Park]]) The headquarters of Studio 100 are located in [[Schelle]] and [[Londerzeel]]. Studio 100 has access to the largest [[recording studios]] in all of Belgium. Frequently, big events are hosted there, such as the preselections for the [[Eurovision Song Contest]]. The Dutch department of Studio 100 resides in the Mediapark in [[Hilversum]]. and Animation studio's in [[Paris]], [[Sydney]] & [[Munich]],{{cite web|url=http://www.studio100animation.net/ |title=Cartoon Studio |publisher=Studio 100 Animation |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} 2 TV stations. Studio 100 bought [[Flying Bark Productions]], so they could create ''[[Master Raindrop]]'' and is continuously doing business with more than 160 broadcasters on average, operate on a regular base in 110 territories worldwide through selling TV, Video On Demand and Home Video Licenses. For example, [[Maya the Bee|Maya The Bee]] has been sold to broadcasters covering even more than 150 countries {{cite web|url=http://www2.studio100.tv/wp-content/uploads/st100-2015-s.pdf |format=PDF |title=Studio 100 - Corporate Overview |publisher=Studio100.tv |accessdate=2015-08-31}} === Personal life === [[File:Samson_en_Gert_met_de_burgemeester,_Plopsland_2017.jpg|thumb|right]] In 1998 he married "Valerie Calliau"{{cite web|url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1022/Celebs/article/detail/3331970/2012/10/15/Belgen-zien-Gert-Verhulst-als-vrouwenverslinder.dhtml|title=Cookies op AD.nl|work=ad.nl}} with whom he had a son (Victor Verhulst, 1993) and a daughter (Marie Verhulst, 1995), before splitting up in 2003. His daughter, Marie Verhulst, is also an actress. At the time of the [[Musical theatre|musical]] "[[Sleeping Beauty]]" there where rumours that Verhulst was having a relationship with [[Karen Damen]] from the popular [[Girl group]], [[K3 (band)|K3]]. Verhulst always denied the relationship, but in February 2005, pictures of the couple appeared in a Dutch newspaper. In April the couple broke up, after a relationship of four years. From 2008 to 2011, Verhulst had a relationship with a restaurant owner from [[Blankenberge]].{{Cite web|title = Cookies op AD.nl|url = http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1022/Celebs/article/detail/3331970/2012/10/15/Belgen-zien-Gert-Verhulst-als-vrouwenverslinder.dhtml|website = www.ad.nl|accessdate = 2015-09-01}} In 2012 Verhulst had a very short relationship with [[Josje Huisman]],{{cite web|url=http://www.vandaag.be/94688_gert-verhulst-en-josje-k3-hebben-relatie.html |title=Gert Verhulst en Josje (K3) hebben relatie |publisher=vandaag.be |date=2012-04-13 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} also a singer from the popular [[Girl group]], [[K3 (band)|K3]], but after a few months they split up. Since then, he has got back with the restaurant owner from [[Blankenberge]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/944/Celebrities/article/detail/1488775/2012/08/21/Gert-Verhulst-opnieuw-samen-met-ex-Ellen.dhtml |title=Gert Verhulst opnieuw samen met ex Ellen |language=nl|publisher=HLN.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} ==Trivia== *In 1999 Verhulst bought an institution for poor children "Villa Zonnelicht" in [[Kapellen, Belgium]] (translated: villa sunlight) {{cite web|url=https://books.google.be/books/about/Villa_Zonnelicht.html?id=3tcHrgEACAAJ&redir_esc=y|title=Villa Zonnelicht|work=google.be}} for [[Belgian franc|BF]]7.100.000 or [[Euro|€]]176.000 and made it his Private home.{{cite web|url=http://www.studio100fan.eu/forum/viewtopic.php?t=2141|title=Studio100fan.eu - Forum • Toon onderwerp - [Interview] De 7 hoofdzonden volgens Gert Verhulst|work=studio100fan.eu}} *In 2007 he won together with "Jelle Cleymans" the second season of "Best friends" at [[Eén]].{{cite web|url=http://www.zita.be/fun/video/769631_jelle-cleymans-gert-verhulst-in-beste-vrienden-deel-1.html |title=Zita Jelle Cleymans & Gert Verhulst in "Beste Vrienden" deel 1 |publisher=Zita.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} *Verhulst was along with Hans Bourlon, elected Manager of the Year by the Belgian weekly Magazine "[[Trends (Belgian magazine)|Trends]]" in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.standaard.be/cnt/0224pv1f |title=Bourlon en Verhulst managers van het jaar - De Standaard |publisher=Standaard.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} *In 2009 Gert Verhulst bought a Motor [[Yacht]] from 36 meter with 8 suites called "Evanna".{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/944/Celebrities/article/detail/852737/2009/05/13/Gert-Verhulst-koopt-jacht-van-1-5-miljoen-euro.dhtml |title=Gert Verhulst koopt jacht van 1,5 miljoen euro |language=nl|publisher=HLN.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} *In 2013 Verhulst announced that Studio 100 had made a USD 50.000 (EUR 38.868) offer at the auction site of the American Federal Agency to buy a disused [[Air Force One]]. The plane would have carried six [[President of the United States|US presidents]] between 1975 and 2005.{{cite web|url=http://www.hbvl.be/cnt/aid1386510/studio-100-wil-amerikaanse-air-force-one-kopen |title=Studio 100 biedt 50.000 dollar voor Air Force One - Het Belang van Limburg |publisher=Hbvl.be |date=2013-05-16 |accessdate=2015-08-31}} *In 2014 he participated in TV Show/contest "De Slimste Mens ter Wereld" (translated: "The Smartest Person in the World"), after the invitation of presenter "[[Erik Van Looy]]". where he was the first time in twelve seasons that survived the eleventh participation. and finished third.{{cite web|url=http://www.vier.be/hetzijnnetmensen/deelnemers/gert-verhulst |title=Gert Verhulst | VIER |language=nl|publisher=Vier.be |date= |accessdate=2015-08-31}} *He stood at the cradle of [[Musical theatre|musicals]] like [[Snow White]], [[Cinderella]], [[Robin Hood]] and [[Sleeping Beauty]]. ==Discography== === Albums === *"Samson & Gert 1" 1991 {{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/nl/album/feb5/Samson-&-Gert-Samson-&-Gert-1 |title=Samson & Gert - revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} <!-- Image with unknown copyright status removed: [[Image:BauerGuillermo.jpg|right|200px]] --> '''Guillermo Bauer''' or '''Wilhelm Bauer''' was the proprietor of the first steam-operated [[flour mill]] in [[Argentina]].
==Biography== He was born on 17 February 1844 in Berg, [[Stuttgart]], [[Germany]] as George Philip Wilhelm Bauer. His parents were Philip Bauer and Catharina Uhlmann. He married María Elisa Sigel, born on 18 December 1851, in Wilheim-Kirchheim, [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]], who was also German.
The first mill was authorized in 1859 by the provincial government of [[Antonio Gaspoz]], who built it on the banks of the Cululú River. The steam mill was installed in the colony of San Carlos by Guillermo Bauer and Juan Siegel, who hoped to have eight mills operational before 1890. They benefitted from the inauguration of the railroad in 1885, because they were able to ship their product to the port of [[Rosario]], where Guillermo was able to receive more money for his product.
By the late 1800s, they were able to cut normal operating costs to the point where the horse-driven mills were closing. Soon after, in the 1890s, Guillermo was honored by the local governor, [[Luciano Leiva]], for giving flour to the poor and contributing money to the local area to stimulate growth. After contributing to the health of many people and giving selflessly, he was honored by a reprographic shop in Rosario, and eventually met [[Pope Leo XIII]], who was touched by his kindness. Guillermo was made the patron saint of reprographers in the early 1900s, and is still honored in many shops today.
He died on 26 April 1912 in Argentina.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bauer, Guillermo}} [[Category:1844 births]] [[Category:1912 deaths]] [[Category:Argentine businesspeople]] [[Category:Argentine people of German descent]] [[Category:Place of birth missing]]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=November 2014}} The '''John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation''' was founded in 1925<ref name="bloomberg">{{cite web|url = http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=4932668 | accessdate = 18 November 2014 | publisher = [[Bloomberg Businessweek]] | title = Company Overview of John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation}}</ref> by Olga and [[Simon Guggenheim]] in memory of their son, who died on April 26, 1922. The organization awards [[Guggenheim Fellowship]]s to professionals who have demonstrated exceptional ability by publishing a significant body of work in the fields of natural sciences, social sciences, humanities, and the creative arts, excluding the performing arts.<ref name="bloomberg" /> The roll of Fellows includes numerous [[Nobel Prize|Nobel]] Laureates, [[Pulitzer Prize|Pulitzer]] and other prize winners.
==Details== Fellowships are intended to provide gifted and skilled people the opportunity to work with as much creative freedom as possible. They are not available to support training or immediate postgraduate work. Fellowships last for between six and twelve months (occasionally longer). The average award amount in 2003 was US$36,000 to 221 fellows. The Foundation supports only individuals. It does not make grants to institutions or organizations. According to Foundation president [[Edward Hirsch]], between 1925 and 2005 the Foundation granted close to $240 million in Fellowships to more than 15,500 individuals. The Foundation selects its Fellows on the basis of two separate competitions, one for Canada and the United States, the other for Latin America and the Caribbean. Competitors submit applications to one of the two Committees of Selection, consisting of about six distinguished scholars or artists.
In 2004 the Foundation awarded 185 Canadian and United States Fellowships for a total of $6,912,000 (an average grant of $37,362). There were 3,268 applicants. In the same year it awarded 36 Latin American and Caribbean Fellowships for a total of $1,188,000 (an average grant of $33,000). There were 819 applicants.
The Guggenheim art museums are funded separately by the [[Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation]].
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.gf.org/ John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20081207063312/http://www.gf.org/gift.html Extracts from Simon Guggenheim's letters of gift to the Foundation]
{{charity-stub}}

{{Orphan|date=September 2018}}
{{Infobox person | name = Kanika Dewan | birth_place = [[Kolkata]] | alma_mater = [[Wharton Business School]] | awards = Guinness Book of World Records (2012) Young Global Leader (2016) | website = kanikadewan.com/ }}
'''Kanika Dewan''' is an interior designer and [[World Economic Forum]] [[Young Global Leaders|Young Global Leader]]. She is a former [[Investment banking|investment banker]] and campaigner against corruption. She has been involved with the development of Terminal 3 at [[Indira Gandhi International Airport]]. She is the president of Bahrain-based natural resources conglomerate Bramco and founder of [http://www.atelierka.com/ Ka Design Atelier].
== Early life and education == Dewan was born in [[Kolkata]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.wikitribune.com/story/2018/01/25/current-affairs/davos-qa-kanika-dewan-artist-in-stone-wants-to-hear-more-from-masses/44392/|title=Davos Q&A: Kanika Dewan - artist in stone wants to hear more from masses|website=WikiTribune|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> Dewan moved to Bahrain when she was two years old, after her father began limestone quarrying in West Asia.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/small-biz/entrepreneurship/kanika-dewan-meet-the-diva-who-designed-floors-of-igis-terminal-3/articleshow/18308539.cms|title=Kanika Dewan: Meet the diva who designed floors of IGI's Terminal 3|last=Kumar|first=K. P. Narayana|date=2013-02-04|work=The Economic Times|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She attended an American school.<ref name=":0" /> After the outbreak of the first [[Gulf War]], Dewan was enrolled in an English boarding school.<ref name=":0" /> She majored in finance at [[Wharton Business School]], graduating in 1998.<ref name=":1"/> She joined [[Citigroup]].<ref name=":0" />
== Career == Dewan worked as an investment banker before setting up her own [[Vertical integration|vertical integrated]] design business, [http://www.atelierka.com/ Ka Design Atelier].<ref name=":1" /> In 2011 she oversaw the design and creation of the [[Guinness World Records]]' largest marble mosaic - a full-size portrait of [[Qaboos bin Said al Said]].<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20110506/ARTICLE/305069915/1002|title=Larger than life|last=Qudoos|first=Mohammad Abdul|website=www.khaleejtimes.com|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> It included 128,274 individual marble pieces and took 3,792 hours to construct.<ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Citation|last=icecreamSoCal|title=Guinness Book of World Records: Largest Marble Mosaic in the World (Making of featurette)|date=2010-11-28|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XdXWGcFtuT4|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> The marble tiles were mined from the Omani territories Wilayat [[Mahdha]], Wilayat of Ibra, Wilayat of Ibri, [[Mirbat|Sadeh Beach]] and Quryat Beach.<ref name=":2" />
Dewan was reading a newspaper in New Delhi when she found out that proposals were underway to develop [[Indira Gandhi International Airport]].<ref name=":1" /> She decided to bid for the design, and her company won.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/magazine/supplement/story/20100816-girl-power-743701-2010-08-04|title=Girl power|website=India Today|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://whartonmagazine.com/issues/spring-2011/making-a-statement/#sthash.uNakRsjm.dpbs|title=Making a Statement|website=whartonmagazine.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She went on to design the [[Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/291013|title="I Wanted to Change India's Impression in the Minds of Americans"|last=Nathani|first=Komal|date=2017-03-24|work=Entrepreneur|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref> Dewan has designed houses and two of the luxury yachts of the [[Sultan of Oman]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.americanbazaaronline.com/2015/04/03/narendra-modis-make-in-india-doesnt-have-incentive-for-local-companies-as-there-are-for-internationals-kanika-dewan/|title=Narendra Modi’s ‘Make in India’ doesn’t have incentive for local companies as there are for internationals: Kanika Dewan – The American Bazaar|date=2015-04-03|work=The American Bazaar|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref> She designed the stone paneling system for [[The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts|The Leela Palace]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.globalteacherprize.org/person?id=5874|title=Kanika Dewan|website=Varkey Foundation|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She was included in the [[Wharton magazine]] 40 Under 40.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://whartonmagazine.com/kanika-dewan/|title=Kanika Dewan|website=whartonmagazine.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2012 she opened the Iron Curtain restaurant in New Delhi, which was home to an area to screen films.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/A-restaurant-for-filmmakers-and-movie-buffs/articleshow/15124202.cms|title=A restaurant for filmmakers and movie buffs - Times of India|work=The Times of India|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2015 she gave the keynote lecture at Innovation Dubai.<ref>{{Citation|last=Kanika Dewan|title=Kanika Dewan Keynote Speech on Innovation Dubai|date=2015-09-06|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dN9Z92q03cU|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She was recognised as a [[Young Global Leaders|Young Global Leader]] by the [[World Economic Forum]] in 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/four-indians-figure-in-wefs-young-global-leaders-class-of-2016/articleshow/51428091.cms|title=Four Indians figure in WEF's Young Global Leaders Class of 2016|date=2016-03-16|work=The Economic Times|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.businesstoday.in/current/economy-politics/4-indians-make-it-to-world-economic-forum-global-leaders-list/story/230338.html|title=4 Indians make it to World Economic Forum global leaders list|website=www.businesstoday.in|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> In 2017 she was part of a [[United Nations]] global initiative that connected 300 Indian leaders.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dnaindia.com/business/report-un-global-compact-to-host-event-of-300-indian-leaders-2410821|title=UN Global Compact to host event of 300 Indian leaders|date=2017-04-21|work=dna|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=TheUNGlobalCompact|title=27 April, 2017 - Kanika Dewan - Closing Plenary|date=2017-05-24|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r7nEsNNU4sE|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref name="Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact">{{Cite web|url=https://www.unglobalcompact.org/take-action/events/making-global-goals-local-business-india/speakers|title=Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact|website=www.unglobalcompact.org|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref> She is concerned about bribery and bureaucratic red tape in India.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294128|title=#3 Challenges Overseas Entrepreneurs Face In India|last=Nathani|first=Komal|date=2017-05-11|work=Entrepreneur|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.business-standard.com/article/economy-policy/corruption-contract-enforcement-major-hurdles-for-ease-of-business-116100600879_1.html|title='Corruption, contract enforcement major hurdles for ease of business'|last=Subramanian|first=N. Sundaresha|date=2016-10-06|work=Business Standard India|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref><ref name="Speakers {{!}} UN Global Compact"/>
=== Awards and honours === 2018 ''Global Overseas Indian Business Woman of the Year''<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.kanikadewan.com/|title=Biography, Press & Keynote Speeches {{!}} Kanika Dewan of Ka Design Ateli|website=Biography, Press & Keynote Speeches {{!}} Kanika Dewan of Ka Design Ateli|language=en|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref>
2013 ''Global Business Woman of the Year'' Entrepreneur of the Year Awards<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://cn.weforum.org/people/kanika-dewan/|title=Kanika Dewan {{!}} 世界经济论坛|website=世界经济论坛|access-date=2018-08-26}}</ref>
2012 [[Society (magazine)]] Young Achiever of the Year<ref name=":4" />
2011 ''Most Innovative Woman of the Year'' Entrepreneur of the Year Awards<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.naaree.com/tag/indian-women-leaders/|title=Indian Women Leaders {{!}} Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|work=Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.naaree.com/naaree-interviews-kanika-dewan-group-president-bramco/|title=Naaree Interviews Indian Woman Entrepreneur, Kanika Dewan, Bramco {{!}} Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|date=2011-10-19|work=Naaree.com - Women At Work {{!}} Indian Woman's Magazine|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en-US}}</ref>
2010 ''Woman Initiative of the Year''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://naseba.blob.core.windows.net/upload/WIL_ME_Post_Event_Report_2010_2nd_edition.pdf|title=2nd Annual Women in Leadership Forum|last=Tolani|first=Teena|date=2010-11-24|website=NASEBA|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-25}}</ref>
2005 Prism Award, Marble Institute of America<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.stoneworld.com/articles/83035-2005-prism-stone-in-architecture-awards|title=2005 Prism Stone In Architecture Awards|access-date=2018-08-26|language=en}}</ref>
2001 Best Design & Workmanship, Marble Institute of America<ref name=":3" />

{{multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=December 2012}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2012}} {{notability|Biographies|date=April 2012}} }}
'''Klaus Heine''' is a lecturer in luxury [[marketing]], luxury [[brand management]], brand personality and brand identity at the [[Technical University of Berlin]] and works as an independent [[consultant]] specializing in luxury brand management.
== Biography == Klaus Heine studied [[Business Administration]] with a focus on [[marketing]] and [[human resources]] at [[Berlin Institute of Technology|Technical University of Berlin (TUB)]] and [[Macquarie University]] in [[Sydney]]. He wrote his [[Master's degree|Master]] thesis at [[ThyssenKrupp]] Asia/Pacific in [[Shanghai]] about the [[marketing]] of European product innovations in China and his doctoral [dissertation] at TUB about the identity of luxury brands. He is currently working as a researcher and lecturer at the chair of marketing at TUB and as an independent [consultant] specializing in luxury brand management.
He conducted qualitative and quantitative luxury consumer surveys in [[Europe]] and on-site in [[China]] and published his research results in scientific and business conferences and international journals. His research initiated a broad press coverage in [[Germany]] with articles for instance in Die Zeit, Handelsblatt, Focus, Manager Magazin, and Süddeutsche Zeitung. Dr. Heine worked for the consulting company trommsdorff + drüner, which is affiliated with the marketing chair, and also on various independent consulting projects, which includes, amongst others, the Luxury Institute New York and Mont Charles de Monaco.

(2012), [http://www.conceptofluxurybrands.com/content/die-identit%C3%A4t-von-luxusmarken#overlay-context=content/32-scope-luxury Die Identität von Luxusmarken], In: The Luxury Business Report, 30 March 2012 * Heine, K. (2011) [www.worldluxurybranddirectory.com The World Luxury Brand Directory], {{ISSN|2193-5440}}, Technische Universität Berlin * Heine, K. (2009) Is Berlin Luxury the Future Luxury? '''Leonard L. (Len) Berry''' (born 1942) is a distinguished professor of marketing at [[Texas A&M University]] and a senior fellow at the [[Patient_safety_organization#Institute_for_Healthcare_Improvement|Institute for Healthcare Improvement]]. Berry is a past president of the [[American Marketing Association]]. He has studied service delivery in healthcare at the [[Mayo Clinic]] and in cancer care settings.
==Biography== Berry earned bachelor's and master's degrees at the [[University of Denver]] and a Ph.D. at [[Arizona State University]].<ref name=TAMU/> A longtime professor at Texas A&M University, Berry founded the school's Center for Retailing Studies in 1982 and directed it for 18 years.<ref name=Fast>{{cite web|title=A baker's dozen of experts|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/resources/customer/experts.html|publisher=[[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company]]|accessdate=May 12, 2015}}</ref> In 1983, Berry coined the term [[relationship marketing]], which emphasizes the need for organizations to maintain (rather than simply acquire) customers.<ref name="MorganParish2015">{{cite book|last1=Morgan|first1=Robert M.|last2=Parish|first2=Janet Turner|last3=Deitz|first3=George|title=Handbook on Research in Relationship Marketing|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=SIMZBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA16|date=30 January 2015|publisher=[[Edward Elgar Publishing]]|isbn=978-1-78347-863-7|page=16}}</ref>
He is the University Distinguished Professor of Marketing and Regents Professor at [[Texas A&M University]]. He holds the M. B. Zale Chair in Retailing and Marketing Leadership in the [[Mays Business School]] at Texas A&M. He has studied healthcare service improvement in association with the Mayo Clinic and as a senior fellow at the Institute for Healthcare Improvement.<ref name=TAMU>{{cite web|title=Leonard L. Berry|url=http://mays.tamu.edu/directory/employees/125/|publisher=[[Texas A&M University]]|accessdate=May 12, 2015}}</ref> Much of Berry's work has focused on service delivery in cancer care.<ref name=IHI>{{cite web|title=Profiles in Improvement: Leonard L. Berry, PhD, MBA, IHI Senior Fellow|url=http://www.ihi.org/resources/Pages/ImprovementStories/ProfilesinImprovementLenBerry.aspx|publisher=[[Patient_safety_organization#Institute_for_Healthcare_Improvement|Institute for Healthcare Improvement]]|date=December 15, 2014}}</ref>
Berry and his wife established the Berry-AMA Book Prize for the Best Book in Marketing for the American Marketing Association (AMA).<ref name=AMAF>{{cite web|title=Berry-AMA Book Prize for the Best Book in Marketing|url=http://www.themarketingfoundation.org/berry_book_prize.html|publisher=American Marketing Association Foundation|accessdate=May 12, 2015}}</ref> He is a past recipient of the AMA/Irwin/McGraw-Hill Distinguished Marketing Educator award. He is on the board of directors for the [[Nemours Foundation]].<ref name=Nemours>{{cite web|title=Leonard L. Berry, Ph.D.|url=http://www.nemours.org/about/leadership/berryleonard.html|publisher=[[Nemours Foundation]]|accessdate=May 13, 2015}}</ref>
Berry has served on the board of directors of [[Genesco]] since 1999.<ref name="bloombergbio">{{cite web|title=Genesco Inc (GCO:New York): Leonard L. Berry Ph.D.|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=589109&privcapId=274846|website=Bloomberg|accessdate=June 24, 2017}}</ref>
His son, [[Matthew Berry]], is a [[fantasy sports]] analyst for [[ESPN]].<ref name=Matthew>{{cite web|last1=Berry|first1=Matthew|title=All in the family|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/fantasy/football/ffl/story?page=TMR120927|publisher=[[ESPN]]|accessdate=May 13, 2015|date=September 27, 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
